intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. petiolascens, commonly known as the petiolate hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single capitulum and bloom from late spring to early autumn. This subspecies is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators.
